subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Letter for "er" as in earth?
msgSnippet: Just a little error Paul: No 12 should be Z-oo but is showing the same as 14. regards Moira ... -- Moira O Brien Tel UK:    +44 7831-625990 (UK) Tel Eire
messageBody:
Just a little error Paul:
 
No 12 should be Z-oo but is showing the same as 14.
 
regards
 
Moira


 
On 06/10/2007, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:

Paige Gabhart wrote:

> I believe Kingsley has some or maybe all of the half letters available.
> That would be nice if you could get that to work properly. But a
> "junior" font where all the glyphs look correct and print properly would
> be excellent. I am wondering if your font will leave spaces between
> adjacent letters, or would it appear to have some of the cursive quality
> as in handwritten senior QS?
>
> Trying to remember my other comments...
>
> 1. Your font seems to be missing the "wh" sound, which many of us use
> when we write because we pronounce the words that way. (I say
> seems because of the rectangular boxes, one of which could have
> had the "wh" glyph for all I know.) It is simply the "w" symbol
> with a hook at the bottom so it should be easy to add to the
> font. To me "which" and "witch" are not pronounced the same.
> People who use this sound find it annoying if the font doesn't
> include it. By the way, adding "wh" was one of the changes Read
> made in going from the Shaw alphabet to QS.
> 2. When I opened the font, in several places there were rectangular
> boxes. I wasn't sure if some of these may have been glyphs not
> displaying correctly. (I didn't have a chance to check to see if
> all the symbols were present.)
> 3. The font should have a naming dot. I don't remember seeing one.
> 4. The font should have angled brackets to use in the place of
> standard parentheses.
>

Thanks for your feedback. I know I need to add the name dot and the
angled brackets (as well as the other ligatures and two optional
characters, which I am in the process of doing). However, all of the
other glyphs should be present. You should be seeing no boxes, and that
you do means something isn't working right. The font does work on both
my linux box and my girlfriend's Mac.

Here is the font (with just slight changes) and a test file. Install the
font, and open up the test file. The test file should explain exactly
what you should see.

Paul
